text: 886445546 | LMC | 72712624 | | 191709 | 10/10/2000 12:00:00 AM | non cardiac chest pain | | DIS | Admission Date: 10/10/2000 Report Status: Discharge Date: 8/14/2000 ****** DISCHARGE ORDERS ****** LINNEAR , JASPER 024-62-57-0 Charl Ton- Service: CAR DISCHARGE PATIENT ON: 2/3 AT 02:00 PM CONTINGENT UPON HO evaluation WILL D/C ORDER BE USED AS THE D/C SUMMARY: YES Attending: ZOMORA , DOUG DANTE , M.D. CODE STATUS: Full code DISPOSITION: Home DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS: ASA ( ACETYLSALICYLIC ACID ) 325 MG PO QD ATENOLOL 25 MG PO QD Starting Today ( 9/1 ) PREMARIN ( CONJUGATED ESTROGENS ) 0.625 MG PO QD NPH HUMULIN INSULIN ( INSULIN NPH HUMAN ) 50 U SC BID HOLD IF: if BG <100 PRINIVIL ( LISINOPRIL ) 40 MG PO QD HOLD IF: SBP<90 Override Notice: Override added on 10/30 by RATAJ , DUSTIN V. , M.D. on order for KCL IMMEDIATE REL. PO ( ref # 62562432 ) POTENTIALLY SERIOUS INTERACTION: LISINOPRIL & POTASSIUM CHLORIDE Reason for override: monitored NAPROSYN ( NAPROXEN ) 375 MG PO BID PRN pain Food/Drug Interaction Instruction Take with food DITROPAN ( OXYBUTYNIN CHLORIDE ) 5 MG PO BID SIMETHICONE 80 MG PO QID ZOCOR ( SIMVASTATIN ) 40 MG PO QHS CARDURA ( DOXAZOSIN ) 1 MG PO QHS ADALAT CC ( NIFEDIPINE ( EXTENDED RELEASE ) ) 30 MG PO QD DIET: No Restrictions RETURN TO WORK: IN 2 DAYS FOLLOW UP APPOINTMENT( S ): Dr. Fjeseth 1 week , ALLERGY: Lovastatin , Hctz ( hydrochlorothiazide ) ADMIT DIAGNOSIS: unstable angina , chf PRINCIPAL DISCHARGE DIAGNOSIS ;Responsible After Study for Causing Admission ) non cardiac chest pain OTHER DIAGNOSIS;Conditions , Infections , Complications , affecting Treatment/Stay GI distress , non cardiac stress pain. OPERATIONS AND PROCEDURES: OTHER TREATMENTS/PROCEDURES ( NOT IN O.R. ) BRIEF RESUME OF HOSPITAL COURSE: 53 yo female with DM , HTN , s/p MI 1980 , presenting with crescendo angina and hypertension. Patient's blood pressure was controlled with Atenolol 25mg qd , prinivil 40 qd , and adalat CC 30 qd. Overnight the patient was noted to be hypertensive with a pulse in the 45's. Cardura 1mg qhs was added for additional control. Patient was taken to cath which revealed clean coronary arteries and LVH with EF 68%. ADDITIONAL COMMENTS: call Dr. Darell Amoako you experience further chest pain. DISCHARGE CONDITION: Stable TO DO/PLAN: follow up with Dr. Quashie regarding further management of BP. No dictated summary ENTERED BY: BROWEN , RODRIGO C. , M.D. ( XP607 ) 2/3 @ 09 ****** END OF DISCHARGE ORDERS ******
